item.title: Roman Emperors
item.description: Introduction From TidyTuesday’s Roman Emperors data set. The chart shows us that elected emperors had longer reigns than those who rose to power by other means and the shortest reigns were by those who purchased their power. Code Below is the code used to create the visualization: #Load the libraries library(tidyverse) library(tidytuesdayR) library(ggthemes) #Custom palette romana = c("#8E1F2F","#702963","#B85C28","#297036", "#F0BC42","#26619C","#321C6F","#1F8E7E") #Read in the dataset emperors <- readr::read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2019/2019-08-13/emperors.csv") #Convert the dates into numeric emperors$reign_start <- as.

item.title: Nautical Twilight
item.description: RStudio IDE and syntax theme https://github.com/lusignan/Nautical-Twilight Compatability RStudio 1.3 Installation To install, run the following in your RStudio console: rstudioapi::addTheme("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lusignan/Nautical-Twilight/main/nautical-twilight.rstheme", apply = TRUE)
